import Mathlib

open Topology Filter Set Matrix

/--
Let $Q$ be an $n$-by-$n$ real orthogonal matrix, and let $u \in \mathbb{R}^n$ be a unit column vector (that is, $u^T u = 1$). Let $P = I - 2uu^T$, where $I$ is the $n$-by-$n$ identity matrix. Show that if $1$ is not an eigenvalue of $Q$, then $1$ is an eigenvalue of $PQ$.
-/
theorem putnam_2019_b3
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(Q : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hQ0 : ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → dotProduct (Q i) (Q j) = 0 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ j) = 0)
(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)
(u : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin 1) ℝ)
(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)
(P : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hP : P = 1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ))
: (Q - 1).det ≠ 0 → (P * Q - 1).det = 0 :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2019_b3
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(Q : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hQ0 : ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → dotProduct (Q i) (Q j) = 0 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ j) = 0)
(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)
(u : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin 1) ℝ)
(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)
(P : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hP : P = 1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ))
: (Q - 1).det ≠ 0 → (P * Q - 1).det = 0 := by
  intro h
  have h1 : (P * Q - 1).det = 0 := by
    rw [hP]
    simp [Matrix.det_one, Matrix.det_sub, Matrix.mul_apply, Matrix.one_apply, Matrix.det_smul]
    rw [← Matrix.det_transpose]

    -- This involves showing that the matrix P * Q - 1 has a zero determinant, which can be done by demonstrating that it has a nontrivial kernel.
    -- The details of the proof would involve using the given conditions and properties of orthogonal matrices to show this.
    <;>
    simp_all [Matrix.det_one, Matrix.det_sub, Matrix.mul_apply, Matrix.one_apply, Matrix.det_smul]
    <;>
    aesop
  exact h1
```

(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)

(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)

```lean4
theorem putnam_2019_b3
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(Q : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hQ0 : ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → dotProduct (Q i) (Q j) = 0 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ j) = 0)
(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)
(u : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin 1) ℝ)
(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)
(P : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hP : P = 1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ))
: (Q - 1).det ≠ 0 → (P * Q - 1).det = 0 := by
  intro h
  have h₁ : (P * Q - 1) = 0 := by
    have h₂ : P = 1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ) := hP
    rw [h₂]
    have h₃ : (1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ)) * Q = Q - 2 * (u * uᵀ * Q) := by
      simp [Matrix.mul_sub, Matrix.sub_mul, Matrix.mul_one, Matrix.one_mul, Matrix.mul_assoc]
      <;>
      simp_all [Matrix.mul_assoc]
      <;>
      aesop
    have h₄ : Q - 2 * (u * uᵀ * Q) = Q - 2 * (u * (uᵀ * Q)) := by
      simp [Matrix.mul_assoc]
    rw [h₄] at h₃
    have h₅ : uᵀ * Q = 0 := by
      have h₆ : ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → dotProduct (Q i) (Q j) = 0 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ j) = 0 := hQ0
      have h₇ : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1 := hQ1
      have h₈ : uᵀ * Q = 0 := by
        -- Use the fact that Q is orthogonal and u is a unit vector to show that uᵀ * Q = 0
        ext i j
        simp_all [Matrix.mul_apply, dotProduct, Fin.sum_univ_succ, Fin.sum_univ_zero]
        <;>
        aesop
      exact h₈
    have h₆ : u * (uᵀ * Q) = u * 0 := by
      simp [h₅]
    have h₇ : u * 0 = 0 := by
      simp
    have h₈ : Q - 2 * (u * (uᵀ * Q)) = Q - 2 * (u * 0) := by
      simp [h₆, h₇]
    have h₉ : Q - 2 * (u * 0) = Q := by
      simp
    have h₁₀ : Q - 2 * (u * 0) = Q := by
      simp
    have h₁₁ : (Q - 1) = 0 := by
      aesop
    simp_all
  simp_all
```

(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)

(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)

```lean4
theorem putnam_2019_b3
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n > 0)
(Q : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hQ0 : ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → dotProduct (Q i) (Q j) = 0 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ j) = 0)
(hQ1 : ∀ i : Fin n, dotProduct (Q i) (Q i) = 1 ∧ dotProduct (Qᵀ i) (Qᵀ i) = 1)
(u : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin 1) ℝ)
(hu : uᵀ*u = 1)
(P : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ)
(hP : P = 1 - 2 * (u * uᵀ))
: (Q - 1).det ≠ 0 → (P * Q - 1).det = 0 := by
  intro h
  have h1 : (P * Q - 1).det = 0 := by
    rw [hP]
    simp [Matrix.det_one, Matrix.det_sub, Matrix.det_mul, Matrix.det_one, Matrix.det_smul]
    <;>
    aesop
  exact h1
```
